page.title: 14CHURCH:DRAYTON BASSETT
page.content: The Parish Church of St. Peter's dominates Drayton Bassett village. Built of local sandstone in Gothic style with nave, chancel and 15th century tower. A church was built here in early 14th century by Sir Ralph Bassett, replacing an earlier building. The Bassett family was associated with the village for 300 years until 1390. The origonal medieval church, decayed by 1793, was rebuilt by Robert Peel (1750-1830). He and his son, Sir Robert Peel (1788-1850) Prime Minister are buried in the church. The church was enlarged and improved in 1854. Stained glass windows and an organ were added by another Peel benefactor (1875). Outside is the old church school (now Post Office) and large church yard with yew trees still in use. Services are held every Sunday. The congregation is small.
